name: Cairo
hint: Capital of Egypt, largest city in Africa and the Arab world

name: Lagos
hint: Largest city in Nigeria and one of the fastest-growing in the world

name: Nairobi
hint: Capital of Kenya, only capital city with a national park

name: Cape Town
hint: Legislative capital of South Africa, beneath Table Mountain

name: Johannesburg
hint: Largest city in South Africa, built on the gold mining industry

name: Addis Ababa
hint: Capital of Ethiopia and seat of the African Union

name: Casablanca
hint: Largest city in Morocco, major Atlantic port

name: Dar es Salaam
hint: Largest city in Tanzania, former capital on the Indian Ocean coast

name: Kinshasa
hint: Capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, faces Brazzaville across the river

name: Accra
hint: Capital of Ghana, located on the Gulf of Guinea coast

name: Algiers
hint: Capital of Algeria, the White City on the Mediterranean

name: Khartoum
hint: Capital of Sudan, where the Blue and White Nile converge

name: Luanda
hint: Capital of Angola, a major port city on the Atlantic coast

name: Kampala
hint: Capital of Uganda, built on seven hills near Lake Victoria

name: Abidjan
hint: Economic capital of Ivory Coast, largest city in the country

name: Maputo
hint: Capital of Mozambique, a port city on the Indian Ocean

name: Tunis
hint: Capital of Tunisia, located near the ruins of ancient Carthage

name: Lusaka
hint: Capital of Zambia, located on a plateau in the southern part of the country

name: Bamako
hint: Capital of Mali, situated on the banks of the Niger River

name: Mogadishu
hint: Capital of Somalia, an ancient port city on the Indian Ocean coast

name: Dakar
hint: Capital of Senegal, westernmost major city on the African mainland

name: Kigali
hint: Capital of Rwanda, one of Africa's cleanest and most modern cities

name: Harare
hint: Capital of Zimbabwe, formerly known as Salisbury during colonial era

name: Douala
hint: Largest city and economic hub of Cameroon, a major port on the Atlantic

name: Ouagadougou
hint: Capital of Burkina Faso, hosts Africa's largest film festival FESPACO

name: Niamey
hint: Capital of Niger, located on the banks of the Niger River

name: Marrakech
hint: Famous Moroccan city known for its vibrant souks and Jemaa el-Fnaa square

name: Zanzibar City
hint: Historic port city on the spice island off Tanzania's coast

name: Mombasa
hint: Second-largest city in Kenya, a major Indian Ocean port with ancient roots

name: Asmara
hint: Capital of Eritrea, UNESCO-listed for its Art Deco Italian colonial architecture

name: Windhoek
hint: Capital of Namibia, situated at about 1700 meters elevation in a highland basin

name: Gaborone
hint: Capital of Botswana, one of the fastest-growing cities in southern Africa

name: Antananarivo
hint: Capital of Madagascar, a hilltop city known as the City of a Thousand

name: Durban
hint: Major port city on South Africa's east coast with large Indian population

name: Pretoria
hint: Administrative capital of South Africa, known as the Jacaranda City

name: Rabat
hint: Capital of Morocco, a coastal city on the Atlantic at the Bou Regreg river mouth

name: Brazzaville
hint: Capital of the Republic of Congo, directly across the river from Kinshasa

name: Tripoli
hint: Capital of Libya, a Mediterranean port city with ancient Roman ruins nearby

name: Abuja
hint: Purpose-built capital of Nigeria since 1991, located in the center of the country

name: Freetown
hint: Capital of Sierra Leone, founded as a home for freed slaves in 1792

name: Conakry
hint: Capital of Guinea, a port city built on Tombo Island and the Kaloum Peninsula

name: Lome
hint: Capital of Togo, a coastal city right on the border with Ghana

name: Libreville
hint: Capital of Gabon, a port city on the west coast straddling the equator

name: Bujumbura
hint: Former capital and largest city of Burundi, on the shore of Lake Tanganyika

name: Fez
hint: Ancient Moroccan city home to the world's oldest continuously operating university

name: Alexandria
hint: Egypt's second city, founded by Alexander the Great on the Mediterranean coast

name: Dodoma
hint: Official capital of Tanzania since 1974, located in the center of the country

name: Yamoussoukro
hint: Political capital of Ivory Coast, home to the world's largest basilica

name: Djibouti
hint: Capital city that shares its name with its country, on the Horn of Africa

name: Nouakchott
hint: Capital of Mauritania, one of the largest cities in the Sahara region
